titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Dick Journeyman dues booklet 1988.062
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-11-06 20:37:26 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: One Journeyman dues booklet for machinist Robert Dick. The booklet was issued by the International Association of Machinists National Lodge 556 located on Parkside Avenue in Brooklyn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single item.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert Dick Journeyman dues booklet, 1951, 1988.062; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One Journeyman dues booklet for machinist Robert Dick. The booklet was issued by the International Association of Machinists National Lodge 556 located on Parkside Avenue in Brooklyn. It is signed by President Patsy Cicola.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
